tg1: Riomed is committed to making the user experience, when accessing our application, an accessible and inclusive one. This accessibility statement applies to our Cellma user application and cellma candidate's portal
tg2: This website is run by RioMed. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website.For example, that means you should be able to:
tg3: Change most colors, contrast levels and fonts
tg4: Zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
tg5: We have also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
tg7: We know some parts of this website are not fully accessible:
tg8: It is not currently easy to navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
tg9: It is not currently easy to listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
tg10: The text will not reflow in a single column when you change the size of the browser window
tg11: You cannot modify the line height or spacing of text
tg12: Live video streams do not have captions
tg13: Some of our online forms are difficult to navigate using just a keyboard
tg14: You cannot skip to the main content when using a screen reader
tg15: There is a limit to how far you can magnify the map on our ‘contact us’ page
tg17: AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
